name: Pop Hits - Which Decade?IV Quiz | Music | 10 Questions

questions.text: "I Wanna Dance With Somebody" sang Whitney Houston. In which decade did she fancy a fling around the dance floor?
questions.explanation:
1980s.

	Whitney danced her way to the top in the US and UK in 1987 with this song. Her worldwide record sales exceeds 140 million.

questions.text: More dancing! This time Lou Bega doing the "Mambo No.5", when was that?
questions.explanation:
1990s.

	Lou Bega, real name David Lubega, topped the charts with this song in 1999.

questions.text: Simon and Garfunkel took their "Bridge Over Troubled Water" to the top in which decade?
questions.explanation:
1970s.

	This classic, written by Paul Simon, topped the charts on both sides of the Atlantic in 1970.

questions.text: In which decade was Elvis Presley "All Shook Up"?
questions.explanation:
1950s.

	Elvis had a hand in writing "All Shook Up". It climbed to #1 in the US and UK in 1957.

questions.text: When did the Police sing "Don't Stand So Close To Me"?
questions.explanation:
1980s.

	Sting wrote this 1980 hit for the Police. It peaked at #10 in the US and #1 in the UK.

questions.text: Hugo Montenegro had a hit with "The Good, the Bad and the Ugly" in which decade?
questions.explanation:
1960s.

	Hugo Montenegro and his Orchestra got this instrumental track to #2 in the US and #1 in the UK in 1968.

questions.text: When did the group U2 visit the "Discotheque"?
questions.explanation:
1990s.

	This 1997 hit for U2 was written by group. It achieved #10 in the US, #1 in the UK.

questions.text: The Beatles asked us all to "Get Back" in which decade?
questions.explanation:
1960s.

	This Lennon-McCartney composition got the Fab Four to the top in 1969.

questions.text: When did the Three Degrees ask "When Will I See You Again"?
questions.explanation:
1970s.

	This 1974 hit for the Three Degrees is probably their most popular track. "When Will I See You Again" got to #2 in the US and #1 in the UK.

questions.text: '"Call Me" was Blondie's request in which decade?
questions.explanation:
1980s.

	This track was produced by Giorgio Moroder and written by Giorgio and Debbie Harry in 1980. It peaked at #1 in the US and UK.
